channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ‘This is a wacky number’: economists cry foul as new government data assumes zero housing inflation in surprising November drop
item.description: The culprit, several economists say, is the extended government shutdown.

item.title: The AI efficiency illusion: why cutting 1.1 million jobs will stifle, not scale, your strategy
item.description: The canary in the coal mine for the broader economy is the crisis facing Black women.

item.title: How Salient, an AI loan processing startup valued at $500 million, grew ARR to $25 million in two years
item.description: Salient cofounder Ari Malik built AI to automate loan servicing, turning collections calls into a high-growth business now valued around $500 million.

item.title: Lovable hits $6.6 billion valuation as its CEO says it wants to be ‘the last piece of software’ companies ever buy
item.description: The Swedish startup raised $330 million as enterprises race to adopt AI-built software.

item.title: Trump says $1,776 ‘warrior dividends’ were made possible partly by tariff revenue, which still lags $100 billion behind what the White House expected
item.description: The one-time check to military personnel will cost the administration $2.6 billion.

item.title: Nasdaq closes sharply higher, Dow and S&P 500 snap 4-day losing streaks
Bonds are having their best year since 2020. Why 2026 may not be as rewarding.
Nasdaq leading stocks higher in final hour; Dow, S&P poised to snap losing runs
How investors can take advantage of a quirky midterm election cycle
Nvidia and other chip stocks rise — but the AI trade may not be back for good
